div.p: Scaevola crassifolia, Labillard. I think this has been a line jump. The specimen with this number in AVH is Scaevola angustata

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; color: #0000ff;

div.p: 96.Leaves also needed & also 96. Sonchus olecaceus , Are both numbers transcribed correctly?

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; color: #0000ff;

p.seg: State Library of South Australia, Adelaide, South Australia.

div.p:
85. Calycothrix tetragona
note. from original transcription: '[86. & 85. added in by Jessie Hussey from previous letter]'.
I am not sure whether the note is on the MS or was a note added by the transcriber. And how does it relate to the last two entries on the list?

114.
Kunzea pomulifera ,
Kunzea pomifera? M used the spelling Kunzea pomifera in his note about its value as a fruit (B89.02.01) and when he first introduced it into his Select Plants (B88.12.01), and but K. pomulifera in subsequent editions B91.09.01 and B95.08.04. F.v.M.
I should be thankful for specimens with ripe seeds
Has this any scent ? What is its greatest hight ? Are the flowers always white?
Could fruiting specimens be also procured
